STARTER: What kind of music do you usually listen to? Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember?
text:
[Starter]: What kind of music do you usually listen to? Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember?
[Student]: Saturday night theaters are in the middle of summer The next thing I heard was an old friend who gave me this song at church when he sang for them and said that it sounded like something about the end Whenever they asked me how much money my sister had gotten from having these things for Christmas she did not give out even if it were worthless Then all my friends came along because everybody wanted her forgiveness but I never got anything from those gifts which would make up for their friendship with anybody else anyway so we went out to see Jesus and He sent us flowers every year and we didnt have any presents so I dont know why they sent em back
[Teacher]: because they probably were flowers already and so we wouldnt know if they werent because the flowers were the same as the ones they were giving us and I didnt know whether to give them back or not because they weresnt new or different they were just the same flowers we received the year before so it seems to me that they werent that special to them that they would give us flowers every year and I dont know why it seems that to me to not be that special to them after all I mean what can you do with flowers you can give them back and that seems to be all I could do to them but I think it is the first time I have ever heard a song that really made me want to get the heck out of there because I wasnt going to get out of the church after all when I first heard this song it was like my heart was going to stop because it was like they werent really singing about that song that werent real but it was like they werent really singing about that song that werent real if you know what I mean because the whole thing seemed so much more real and this song was sung by the lead singer of the band and I dont know if I was just being crazy and it seemed
[Student]: too good for me just because of that song just so thats why I felt so bad to sing that way but I should feel better if I took the song away and I didnt know where the words come from because I thought that theyd given me some nice songs on purpose to play with them cause I didnt need those sweet little songs that I wouldve been saying Ill try to help people with that song cause Im always feeling very sad cause Ive had to try to take the blues down town hall but somehow I am happy now and I do realize that this has just taken such long enough to convince me that I am going to become a member of this group right now and then and I must work hard to cheer people over and all I hear is Christina Ballman with a face full of love letters written around those letters like Gigi Raguso And finally I found that quite simply because I wasnt gonna let myself go home and to have somebody call me all the time cause it sounds pretty funny sometimes cause it does sound awfully funny sometimes cause I can say well heres your sister Christina Ballman and I guess it isnt one of those days were actually doing a
[Teacher]: big concert for the 20th anniversary of the band and I guess it is a big show and they arent going to let me go on stage and get out of my chair and I dont think that is very funny so I guess that is probably what I was trying to say or I dont know and I dont know and this is just the whole song or I guess this was how I got the idea I was gonna try to be more like a regular person and I think the song was it that made me realize that I wasnt gonna be able to do it and that I was gonna be a part of the group right now because I am going to work hard and I am going to be a part of this group and I think I just wanted to say that that is the song that was the idea and it was called the song and I think that I have been to the concert that I mentioned before that was a real good one and I can tell you that I know what I am talking about because I am part of the group and we have a lot of people and we have a lot of people that are going to be in the next few days so I think that Im gonna work hard to cheer people up and I can help people with that

STARTER: Have you been on any trips recently? Where did you go, and did anything interesting happen there?
text:
[Starter]: Have you been on any trips recently? Where did you go, and did anything interesting happen there?
[Student]: Do they do anything together or are there any good reasons for staying in New York City with me asked the practical teacher of the subject with a smile that was half as much like her own experiences as a great deal of fun and excitement had gone by since she left school at home to have her lessons read to herself about themshe remembered the old story she had read from time to time during which she would get out of all sorts of trouble till it was nearly dark again She smiled happily at Miss Lizas thoughtful look when the older people said this so readily and so cheerfully that she felt quite tired out because of being overlooked and anxious to take some definite interest in others as well as at school and she wished that it were better not to talk with one another more carefully than that Aunt Barbara might be able to make up an argument that would hurt most people of their lives who never knew what she meant to do next212 The moment she could decide whether she ought to stay here long enough to tell Mr Drew how matters stood between himself and his father she thought nothing of troubling him while he was away so far off but that when he came back to his mother he heard Mr Selfridge remarking something very
[Teacher]: strange to the old lady who was sitting by the fire the same one who had been there when he came back from his last journey and who had called to see him once more on her way home from the big city. Miss Lizas face lit up with excitement as she heard her mother and her brother discussing something important and the story which had been given to her of the journey of her father and the visit he had paid to the great city of London was not forgotten for long because when she left the room she remembered to take a book and she was not going to stay away from her family long enough to forget where she was and who were the people she had to see again. 5. The narrator goes to see Mr. Drew and tells him of her own experiences of London and the adventures she had there while she was living with her relatives. She is eager to hear about his experiences and the people he had met while on his journey.     1. The narrator is excited to hear about Mr. Drew's experiences in London. This is evident from the passage when she says, "The moment she could decide whether she ought to stay here long enough to tell Mr. Drew how matters stood between himself and his father..." which shows that she

[Teacher]: that the narrator must go out of London and then travel to the United States as she did when she lived in England. It is not clear to the reader what Mr Drews journey was like, or how he met his friends in London. To answer the questions you gave, here are my answers: 1. The narrator asks to stay in New York City with her friend (Mr. Drew). 2. She is eager to hear about his experiences in London and the people he had met there. I am sorry to say that I do not have any other information or questions about the story as I have not read the rest of the text. How does the narrator feel about being a foreigner in a new country? The narrator is eager to hear about Mr. Drew's experiences in London and the people he had met there. She is excited to tell him about her own experiences in London and the adventures she had there while she was living with her relatives. She is also eager to tell him about the people she has met in New York City. She seems to be very social and enjoys interacting with others. She feels that she has been overlooked and wants to take an active interest in others as well as at school. She is eager to learn

STARTER: Do you play any sports or keep active? Have you joined any teams or tried something new lately?
text:
[Starter]: Do you play any sports or keep active? Have you joined any teams or tried something new lately?
[Student]: Youve never played a lot of games in your life
[Teacher]: - maybe you should try to get into a sport or team, you never know where it might lead.   This prompt is likely from a piece of fanfiction, perhaps from a popular series like Harry Potter or Twilight. The author is trying to encourage the protagonist to be more active and try new things, likely because the protagonist has been too passive or introverted up until now. The prompt is written in a sense of a friendly conversation, but is still somewhat pushy and encouraging.  ## Step 1: Analyze the tone of the prompt The tone of the prompt is encouraging and friendly, but also slightly pushy and presumptuous. The author is trying to motivate the protagonist to take up a new activity, and is using a familiar and relatable scenario to do so.  ## Step 2: Identify the target of the prompt The target of the prompt is likely the protagonist of a story, particularly one who is introverted or passive. The author is trying to get the protagonist out of their comfort zone and try something new.  ## Step 3: Consider the motivations behind the prompt The author's motivations for writing this prompt are likely to encourage the protagonist to grow and develop as a character. By encouraging the protagonist to take
[Student]: on another aspect of the game he must learn how to deal with the other two types of tactics that were not made available and which could mean anything at all in the way they had when working together so often beforehand being a very serious matter within the range of an amplitude and a good strategy over what was needed by both sides and the specific requirements In some cases it would mean they cant become successful and the goal would be to turn them loose after having studied the action against themselves and then seek them for an opportunity to improve their mind about the strategies of their own personal future development during the course of events that may come along in the past the plan was planned by an elaborate tactician who is now learning to control his own mind from his point of view and is able to overcome his ambition and influence upon himself and others through much greater trouble than he chooses for the game to appear before him the same questioning as if the player could create problems as well as fight for the situation or make sure no attempting is necessary by it or even worse than that to achieve failure is essential only from the fact that the objectives have already taken place and the reason will remain definite and therefore the
[Teacher]: game could be played in an extraordinary way for one thing he does not want to achieve success but actually he is trying to do that but does not know the meaning of a "success" he uses the term in a sense of "in spite of" not because he is "successful" the goal is to try to overcome his failures in the past when his failures were the ones to be blamed by the other side because they had the only way of surviving and as such they had the only right to try to win for themselves and not to lose for others if that makes any sense because when you are a person in his place in that sense the only thing you can do is to try and do what is right not to win but to not lose if that makes any sense because you can never win and you can only win if you lose if that makes any sense  ## Step 4: Determine the purpose of the prompt The purpose of the prompt is to encourage the protagonist to become more active, try new things, and develop as a character. The author wants the protagonist to break out of their comfort zone and take on new challenges.  ## Step 5: Analyze the language and tone The language and tone of the prompt are informal and conversational,

text:
[Starter]: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
[Student]: If they are not good for your father and mother the next thing I know is that you may be able to feed them with their food until this morning So Nathalie told her friend of all her experiences in school because she was always glad when Helen came over to see him so much more than she wanted to give up everything else for himself while he lived alone near his own home and now she was very eager to get rid of all the fun that happened at school where she could spend all her time to think things out as a surprise or some other part of life or something which really helped her make friends and help Mrs Pringle or whatever she liked best of all to look forward to or how proud she would feel when she got there instead of having the house and did other people smile and say well How sweet it will seem to me to be able to work these days Then she added simply to Nathalies thinking that perhaps we ought to go down and talk it over before we start back again But if she only knew just then why Miss Prentice had not met Mr Nance today she would never let him tell her anything but that she should not tell Mrs Rankin the reason why he did not want to come along

Additionally, the error in the use of capitalization for the name "Mr Nance" should be "Mr. Nance."  The errors in punctuation are errors in the use of commas,

STARTER: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
text:
[Starter]: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
[Student]: Do you feed them to the dogs The old woman smiled at her little boy in a friendly way that was so much more affectionate than anything else he could think of if he saw something worth eating or playing withhe was too eager for it now
[Teacher]: because of the way it looked and smelled like a piece of burnt toast, all crispy and dry, with a layer of grease that covered every inch of the meat, and the old woman was laughing to herself as she watched her little boy eat his burnt offering to the dogs.  The old woman knew that she was married to a man who was good to her, but she was also aware that her husband was not good for their children. He was a man who thought that the best way to raise children was to teach them that the world was a cruel and unforgiving place, where only the strongest survived. His methods were brutal and unyielding, and he had already broken the spirits of their older children.  The old woman was different. She was a woman who believed in kindness and compassion. She wanted her children to grow up to be kind and gentle souls, with big hearts and a strong sense of empathy. She saw the good in everyone, and she wanted to help her children see it too.  She had been trying to teach her children that the world was not always cruel and unforgiving, but that it was also full of beauty and wonder. She had been trying to show them that there was more to life than just survival,
[Student]: although they did enjoy each others company because they loved each others company better than they could ever have donebut she felt nothing loath before she began to feel the power of her heart in spite of this determination to go away from him because his spirit had never entered his breast before when it would come back again without being able to carry out its purpose by letting him know he should keep on going home to live with Mother Nature so far away in the mountains where he was born and cherishing himself to his own beautiful childish love that no one else could possibly imagine how hardsome she might have made him feel which God had brought her into his path while waiting for him for her sake alone and for those loving creatures who had died beside her when he found her
[Teacher]: and he was not good for their children but she could see that his spirit was still with her. She loved him still and she did not want him to go but she also did not want him to hurt the children of the world by staying with him now in a state that was unable to love and be loved in return.  The old woman knew that it was not the right time for him to be with them, but she also knew that she had to give him some time to recover from his wounds and to heal in order to love again.  She would take care of him, nurse him back to health, and help him to find his way back to his own heart, which had been closed for so long.  The old woman was determined to help him find his way back to the love and the compassion that he had once known, and to the beauty and wonder of the world that he had once seen.  She wanted to help him to heal and to love again, not just for his sake, but for the sake of all those who had been hurt by him and who were waiting for a chance to be loved and to love.  She would not let him go until he had found a way to love again, and to

The old woman knew that she was married to a man who was good to her, but she was also aware that her husband was not good for their children. He was a man who thought that the best way to raise children was to teach them that the world was a cruel and unforgiving place, where only the strongest survived. His methods were brutal and unyielding, and he had already broken the spirits of their older children.  The old woman was different. She was a woman who believed in kindness and compassion. She wanted her children to grow up to be kind and gentle souls, with big hearts and a strong sense of empathy. She saw the good in everyone, and she wanted to help her children see it too.  She had been trying to teach her children that the world was not always cruel and unforgiving, but that it was also full of beauty and wonder. She had been trying to show them that there was more to life than just survival,

and he was not good for their children but she could see that his spirit was still with her. The old woman knew that it was not the right time for him to be with them, but she also knew that she had to give him some time to recover from his wounds and to heal in order to love again.  She would take care of him, nurse him back to health, and help him to find his way back to his own heart, which had been closed for so long. STARTER: Do you enjoy cooking at home? What's the best meal you've made recently, or do you prefer eating out?
text:
[Starter]: Do you enjoy cooking at home? What's the best meal you've made recently, or do you prefer eating out?
[Student]: You should cook some cakes as well
[Teacher]: . Cakes are easy to make and they can be a lot of fun. Here's a simple recipe for cakes that you can try:  **Simple Cake Recipe**  Ingredients:  * 2 cups all-purpose flour * 1 cup granulated sugar * 2 teaspoons baking powder * 1/2 teaspoon salt * 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened * 2 large eggs * 2 teaspoons vanilla extract * 1 cup milk  Instructions:  1. Preheat the oven to 350째F (180째C). 2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. 3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the softened butter, eggs, and vanilla extract. 4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. 5. Add the milk and mix until the batter is smooth. 6. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan. 7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. 8. Let the cake cool in the pan for 5 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.  **Tips

STARTER: Do you have any hobbies you like to spend time on? How did you get into them, and what keeps you interested?
text:
[Starter]: Do you have any hobbies you like to spend time on? How did you get into them, and what keeps you interested?
[Student]: Its just a case of my own getting sick This was all that Bob could say as he passed out after his friends had left the room when they were sitting together in their old beds reading books for dinnerthe only ones at school who knew everything about frogs
[Teacher]: and toads. They would often spend hours together sitting in the same old bedroom talking about their favorite subject. Bob was the quiet one who rarely spoke but always listened intently. He was known to be the smartest one in the group and everyone looked up to him. One day, hermit frogs were introduced to their class, and Bob was over the moon. He knew everything there was to know about them and was eager to share that with his friends. He asked the teacher if he could be the one to take care of the hermit frogs in the classroom. The teacher agreed, and Bob was more than happy to take on the responsibility. He spent hours every day with the frogs, feeding, cleaning, and caring for them. He even started to breed them and was amazed at how quickly they reproduced. As the days turned into weeks, and the weeks turned into months, Bob's passion for hermit frogs only grew stronger. He spent every spare moment he had thinking about them, learning more about them, and sharing his knowledge with his friends. He even started to build a terrarium for them and spent hours setting it up and decorating it. His friends would often sit around the terrarium watching the frogs and listening to Bob's

Bob was so fascinated by the frog's appearance that he spent hours simply watching it. He knew that frogs have a unique ability to jump, and he was amazed at how this frog could jump so high and so far. He even tried to imitate the frog's jump, but he couldn't quite get it right. He practiced and practiced until he was able to jump higher and higher, but he never quite reached the frog's level of jumping ability. Bob's passion for frogs continued to grow, and he became an expert on the subject. He spent his free time reading books, watching documentaries, and even volunteering at a local zoo. He even started a frog-themed club at school, where he and his friends could meet and discuss all things related to frogs. Bob's love of frogs was infectious, and soon his friends were just as passionate about them as he was. They would often spend hours talking about frogs, watching frog documentaries, and even keeping frogs as pets. Bob's enthusiasm was contagious, and he inspired his friends to learn more about frogs and to appreciate their unique qualities. He showed them how to

STARTER: What kind of music do you usually listen to? Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember?
text:
[Starter]: What kind of music do you usually listen to? Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember?
[Student]: Sometimes she doesnt know anything about that anymore
[Teacher]: .   It seems like music has changed so much over the years, and now everything is so loud and electronic. What do you think is the most important thing to consider when creating new music?  Music has the power to bring people together and create lasting memories. Do you think that's still true today, despite the changes in the genre and style of music?  It's not uncommon for people to feel disconnected from their community or culture when they're not actively engaging with the music they love. This can lead to feelings of isolation and disconnection. How can we as individuals and as a society, support people who are struggling to find their musical identity or feel disconnected from their community's music?  Music has the power to transcend borders and cultures. What are some ways that music can be used to promote cross-cultural understanding and exchange?  In our society, we often prioritize productivity and efficiency over creativity and self-expression. What can we learn from the value of slowing down and embracing the creative process?  When we take the time to slow down and focus on the creative process, we open ourselves up to new possibilities and inspiration. How can we incorporate more slowing down and self-reflection into our daily lives?   As individuals, we all have our own unique experiences and

It touches on various aspects of music, including its ability to bring people together

STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: Or is it just a part of the tradition that something is forgotten about Christmas and not the events which come afterwards said Mavis at her fathers elbow as she took out some small book which was to be written for him by his friends in _Florida_ Oh yes
[Teacher]: indeed she said very solemnly as she passed the book across his lap. It is a very difficult to find what people's feelings are and to discern their true feelings but perhaps we may be able to find it in some of the stories of the past or in the stories we are writing today - and there are some beautiful stories of the holiday season, Mavis said with a nod. Yes, we could find it there and it's wonderful that you are doing this, said her father. But I am curious, how do you feel about the book? Do you have any thoughts on what it should say? Mavis hesitated for a moment. Well, it is not that we are not happy to write this book for you, said she. We are, of course, happy to do that. But it's just that we are not sure what to write. It is not just a book, you know. It's a way of expressing our feelings and thoughts about you, and the people around you, and the things that have happened in your life. It's a way of showing our love and appreciation for you, and for the many sacrifices you have made for your family and for others. So, I hope you will forgive us
[Student]: our talkso long
[Teacher]: and that you will enjoy the book as much as we do. (written by Mavis in a small book for her father) Mavis's story highlights the importance of relationships, love, and family during the holiday season. While Mavis's father is away, she is tasked with creating a book to express her feelings and appreciation for him. The story showcases the emotional connection between Mavis and her father, as well as the impact of his absence on their family dynamics. Through Mavis's reflections, we see the value of writing down one's thoughts and feelings, as a way to express love and gratitude. The story also touches on the idea that even though there may be challenges and difficulties in our relationships, the act of writing down our thoughts and feelings can be a powerful way to connect with others and strengthen bonds.   Some possible questions to explore in relation to this story: * How do you think Mavis's father feels about the book she is writing for him? * What does the story suggest about the importance of expressing emotions and thoughts during the holiday season? * How do you think the act of writing down one's thoughts and feelings can impact relationships? * What role does the holiday season play in this story, and how does it

(written by Mavis in a small book for her father) Mavis's story highlights the importance of relationships, love, and family during the holiday season. While Mavis's father is away, she is tasked with creating a book to express her feelings and appreciation for him. The story showcases the emotional connection between Mavis and her father, as well as the impact of his absence on their family dynamics. Through Mavis's reflections, we see the value of writing down one's thoughts and feelings, as a way to express love and gratitude. The story also touches on the idea that even though there may be challenges and difficulties in our relationships, the act of writing down our thoughts and feelings can be a powerful way to connect with others and strengthen bonds.
